page.title: 05Nether Stowey: Properties
page.content: Many residences within the area are old cottages made from a variety of materials. Many are stone, some are cob and thatched and a common feature is the old roofs of pantiles made from Bridgwater clay. Several old places still retain their inglenook fireplaces and beams but have been modernised to provide extra facilities such as bathrooms. The majority of houses are privately owned. There are some council houses which are rented. A few people live in tythe cottages. With the recent growth of population many new homes have been built, and consequently the majority of dwellings in this area are constructed from brick under tiled roofs.
